createData.title: OAuth fails with invalid_scope error when connecting Google Calendar
createData.description:
## Summary

User reports OAuth error when connecting Google Calendar. After completing the OAuth flow, user is redirected to a 404 page instead of successful connection.

## Root Cause

Likely cause: When users deny certain required OAuth permissions (specifically calendar.acls.readonly), the backend redirects to /calendar/google/error. However, this frontend route doesn't exist, causing a 404 error.

## Reproduction Steps

1. Navigate to Calendar settings
2. Click 'Connect Google Calendar'
3. Complete OAuth flow with at least one scope unchecked
4. Observe 404 error on redirect

## Current Behavior

User gets 404 error page after OAuth redirect. Calendar connection fails silently.

## Expected Behavior

User should see error page explaining which permissions are required, or be redirected back to settings with clear error message.

## Additional Context

- Browser: Chrome 120
- OS: macOS Sonoma 14.2
- Error: invalid_scope

operations.reasoning: Clear bug report with specific error message, reproduction context, and system details. No existing tickets found for this specific OAuth error.
